intro: Capparis jacobsii, commonly known as the Jacobs' caper, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round, green fruits that turn red when mature. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal and arid environments. The species is notable for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
